pullRequest.body:
We add a new lemma `eq_of_le_inf_le_of_le_sup` for proving two comparable elements are equal in a modular lattice.
It is the same as the existing `eq_of_le_inf_le_of_sup_le` but with the hypotheses in simp normal form, 
having`y âŠ“ z â‰¤ x` and `y â‰¤ x âŠ” z` instead of `y âŠ“ z â‰¤ x âŠ“ z` and `y âŠ” z â‰¤ x âŠ” z`. The weaker hypotheses easily imply the stronger ones, and proving them in many applications involves slightly less boilerplate. 

We also golf the proof of the original lemma using the (shorter) proof of the new one. 

---

nodes.body:
> Maybe you can simply delete the original since it is clearly strictly weaker? (you have used `le_inf_iff` and `sup_le_iff`, but you could have most directly done `hinf.trans inf_le_left`, `le_sup_left.trans hsup`)

I would prefer to leave it; it can be convenient, since inf_eq_inf and sup_eq_sup-type terms show up frequently when dealing with modular lattices, and are sometimes already at hand when you want to apply the lemma.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
